newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank sees double digit 96/97 group prft growth.
newsitem.headline: Softbank sees double digit 96/97 group prft growth.

text.p: Softbank Corp expects double digit growth in its group profits in the current business year ending on March 31, Softbank president Masayoshi Son told Reuters on Tuesday.
He also said that all of Softbank's group businesses are expected to be in the black in the current 1996/97 business year.
"On a group basis, all of our businesses are expected to be in the black. Our business results will help you understand that we have a sound business and are growing considerably," said Son.
He also said that the company's parent and group earnings results for the current business year would be announced on April 24.
Softbank's group current profit was 14.4 billion yen in the 1995/96 business year, while group sales reached 171.1 billion yen.
